definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
to travel at night and lie low by day (idiom)

sentences.english: Madrid, a city of night-walking dancers and day-drinking scholars. A city of pleasure and pain.
sentences.chinese: 马德里，舞者夜行文人昼饮之痛并快乐城市。

sentences.english: Owls are nocturnal animals, which means that they sleep during the day and hunt at night.
sentences.chinese: 猫头鹰是夜行性动物，白天睡觉夜间猎食。

sentences.english: Bats are nocturnal animal, so do owl.
sentences.chinese: 蝙蝠和猫头鹰都是夜行性动物。

sentences.english: Certain nocturnal wading birds produce these silhouettes among the marshes.
sentences.chinese: 夜行陂泽间的某些涉禽是会有那种形象的。

sentences.english: The fugitives travelled by night andrested by day .
Solifuges are divided into two groups - nocturnal and diurnal.
sentences.chinese: 避日蛛大体能分为两种生活方式，夜行和昼夜行。

sentences.english: Most mice are nocturnal , but the African grass mouse is active during daylight hours.
sentences.chinese: 多数老鼠是夜行性的，但是非洲草鼠在白天活跃。

sentences.english: Jerboas are considered nocturnal, spending daylight hours catching shut-eye in underground tunnels.
sentences.chinese: 跳鼠是夜行动物，白天在地下隧道中补眠。

sentences.english: The Milky Way sparkles above slit-topped canyons as a nocturnal gecko hunts for insects.
sentences.chinese: 银河在裂缝顶部闪烁，夜行壁虎在捕食昆虫。

sentences.english: Sugar gliders are nocturnal and native to Australia.
sentences.chinese: 蜜袋鼯是夜行动物，原产澳洲。

sentences.english: Nocturnal creatures, the northern hairy-nosed wombat is rarely seen by humans.
sentences.chinese: 北毛鼻袋熊是夜行性动物，人类很少能看到它们。

sentences.english: The fugitives traveled by night and rested by day.
We are merely walkers in the night.

definition: to go for a walk in the snow
nocturnal/to hide by day and come out at night
to go to some place at night/to take a night trip to (a place)/to sleepwalk
night scene/the dim light of night
to grope about in the dark
